newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania's foreign debt rises in July.
newsitem.headline: Romania's foreign debt rises in July.

text.p: Romania's total medium- and long-term foreign debt rose to $6.34 billion at end-July from $6.2 billion in June, central bank data showed on Wednesday.

Most of Romania's end-July total foreign debt, or some $2.75 billion, came from international lenders, including the International Monetary Fund -- $783.3 million -- and World Bank -- $971.3 million, a central bank report showed.
By end-July, the state had borrowed around $4.15 billion and guaranteed some $1.67 billion in foreign loans to state and private companies, the report said.
State and private companies also took some $532.9 million in credits guaranteed by local commercial banks.
The country's foreign exchange reserves, including around 87 tonnes of gold, were $2.92 billion at end-July.
Romania has recently launched a borrowing programme on international markets, raising around $720 million in its first Eurobonds and Samurais in May and June.
It also launched 30 billion yen worth of five-year Samurais in September and expects $175 million in a syndicated loan. -- Luli Popescu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
